messages.title: Dear Resident
messages.content: At the coming general election, we face a stark choice between Boris Johnson's Conservatives pushing his terrible Brexit deal, and those who are willing to stand up for an open, fair and inclusive future for our country.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposes Boris Johnson's Brexit deal, implies a commitment to fighting for the residents' interests and doing everything possible to stop Brexit and get a final say on a deal.
Campaigning for more money for schools to ensure they do not have to close early and have what they need to provide children with the best start.
Has expertise internationally and at the local level to tackle climate change. Has a strong green agenda with policies aimed at achieving zero carbon and protecting nature and biodiversity.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The Liberal Democrats are the only party that can challenge the Conservatives. Labour do not have a single councillor in the area and are a distant third according to a recent poll.

issues.brexitEurope: Opposes Boris Johnson's Brexit deal and wants to stop the damage that Brexit is causing.
issues.education: Campaigning for more money for schools to ensure they do not have to close early.
issues.environment: Has expertise to tackle climate change and has a green agenda aimed at achieving zero carbon and protecting nature and biodiversity.
issues.health: Implies a commitment to protecting the NHS

politicalExperience.role: Councillor at South Cambs District Council
politicalExperience.achievements: Part of making the council recognised as one of the greenest in the country.

images.caption: Pippa Heylings - Liberal Democrat campaigner for South East Cambs

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet indicates that Pippa Heylings is committed to stopping Brexit, tackling climate change, protecting the NHS, and providing a brighter future for the country. It also suggests tactical voting considerations in South East Cambridgeshire.
